privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.content: This Privacy Policy describes Our policies and procedures on the collection, use, and disclosure of Your information when You use the Service and tells You about Your privacy rights and how the law protects You. We use Your Personal data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, You agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy has been created with the help of the Privacy Policy Generator.

generalTerms.title: General Terms
generalTerms.content:
These General Terms govern all quotations and purchase orders (PO) for goods and/or services, either directly or electronically, between the Customer and PT Nusa Network Prakarsa (“NNP”). By placing an order, the Customer agrees that these terms apply to every transaction.

1. Definitions
“Contract” means an agreement binding the Parties and forming a single entity with these General Terms. “Purchase Order (PO)” means a document containing the Customer’s request for goods and/or services, including detailed information such as PO number, item type, quantity, delivery address, and signatures. “Quotation” means a written offer from NNP specifying prices, quantities, payment terms, and other conditions. “Price” refers to the total cost owed by the Customer to NNP. “Invoice” is a document granting NNP the right to collect payment for goods or services delivered.

2. Terms
NNP will review specifications and sign the PO upon receipt. Once agreed, the PO cannot be cancelled or changed unilaterally. If a Customer cancels the PO, NNP is entitled to impose a 30% penalty of the total order value. NNP is not responsible for obligations or rights not explicitly stated in the Quotation or PO, or for any loss resulting from Customer negligence.

3. Price, Billing, and Payment
Prices include applicable taxes and fees unless otherwise stated. Payment must be made in full as specified in the Quotation or PO. Late payments incur a 2% monthly penalty. If payment is not received by the due date, NNP may take legal or collection actions without court authorization until payment is completed.

4. Confidentiality
Both Parties must safeguard each other’s confidential information. “Confidential Information” includes all business, technical, or proprietary information shared under this agreement. Disclosure is only permitted when required by law or authorized in writing.

5. Force Majeure
Neither Party shall be liable for failure or delay in performance due to causes beyond reasonable control, including natural disasters, war, government actions, strikes, epidemics, or pandemics. If such conditions persist for more than 30 days, both Parties shall meet to determine whether to terminate or continue the order.

6. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution
These General Terms are governed by the laws of Indonesia. Any dispute shall first be settled amicably within 30 calendar days. If unresolved, disputes shall be submitted to the West Jakarta District Court or the Indonesian National Arbitration Board (BANI) in Jakarta.

By proceeding with any transaction, the Customer acknowledges understanding and acceptance of these General Terms.
